issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
While working through the installfest, I was working through the [Offline Instance Migration to RHEL 7 Between NCs|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/rhel7_vm_migration_offline_remote_NC.html] instructions.

For the most part, everything went well. Of the three instances I went to migrate:

* all 3 instances appeared to survive {{nodeadmin-pack-instance}} correctly
* 2 of the 3 instances survived {{nodeadmin-unpack-instance}} correctly

However, 1 of the instances failed during the unpack, as shown here:

{code}
[root@odc-c-24 instances]# nodeadmin-unpack-instance --sc-host-port 10.104.10.12:8773 i-89995979-pack.tgz
Redirecting to /bin/systemctl status  eucalyptus-nc.service
ERROR: Missing environment variables $EUCALYPTUS, $AXIS2C_HOME and LD_LIBRARY_PATH
[root@odc-c-24 instances]# export EUCALYPTUS=/
[root@odc-c-24 instances]# export AXIS2C_HOME=/usr/lib64/axis2c
[root@odc-c-24 instances]# export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$AXIS2C_HOME/lib:$AXIS2C_HOME/modules/rampart
[root@odc-c-24 instances]# nodeadmin-unpack-instance --sc-host-port 10.104.10.12:8773 i-89995979-pack.tgz
Redirecting to /bin/systemctl status  eucalyptus-nc.service
INFO: unpack on i-89995979-pack.tgz
/bin/tar: Removing leading `/' from member names
/bin/tar: Removing leading `/' from member names
searching for '/instance/volumes/volume' in '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAVYMONHCAYNUI6BOZ/i-89995979/instance.xml'
Searching for IP by hostname odc-c-24.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com
Found local iqn= and local ip=10.104.10.24
libvirt: Storage Driver error : Cannot access storage file '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAVYMONHCAYNUI6BOZ/i-89995979/link-to-vdb' (as uid:107, gid:107): No such file or directory
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 306, in <module>
    sys.exit(main(args, log_level))
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 296, in main
    instance_tuple[1], args.packed_file, args.sc_host_port)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 248, in unpack_instance
    _restore_instance(instance_name, instance_path)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 182, in _restore_instance
    os.path.join(instance_path, "%s%s" % (instance, _INSTANCE_RAM)))
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/libvirt.py", line 4368, in restore
    if ret == -1: raise libvirtError ('virDomainRestore() failed', conn=self)
libvirt.libvirtError: Cannot access storage file '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAVYMONHCAYNUI6BOZ/i-89995979/link-to-vdb' (as uid:107, gid:107): No such file or directory
{code}

I've left the source NC on CentOS 6.7 (ie, I haven't wiped it yet). And unfortunately the CLC hasn't been fully restored post-install of CentOS 7.2 (which I'll be tracking in another EUCA shortly).

However, for your reference, in case you'd like to have a look around:

* frontend: odc-c-12
* NC (CentOS 7.2): odc-c-24
* NC (CentOS 6.7): odc-f-16

The packed instances (both successful and unsuccessful) are present on both NCs in /root/instances/.

I did collect a sosreport from the CLC prior to upgrading to CentOS 7.2. You can find it under {{/sos/jimc/backup/odc-c-12}} on any of the 3 machines listed, above.

Conspicuously absent from euca-describe-instances verbose is the imaging worker, which I know for certain was running before I started the upgrade. I have a suspicion based on another issue seen previously at a customer some months back that this issue might be related. (I don't have the ticket info immediately handy; I'll need to check with the CS team on this.)

Edit: With [~radams]'s help, the other issue I thought was tied to this one is EUCA-11778. After checking it, it's not quite the same issue.
fields.summary: nodeadmin-unpack-instance fails for instaces that do not use DM

comments.body: [~jbreiding], is that a duplication of a known issue?

Is the file linked to by /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAVYMONHCAYNUI6BOZ/i-89995979/link-to-vdb present?

Did the NC run out of space and the unpacking not actually complete?

So for some reason that instance doesnt even show in the euca-describe-instances also looking at the original centos 6 source the packing of that instance wasn't successful.

The block files have no associated .dm files which is how the pack script knows to find the device to read into a blocks.save file.

I also do not see anything for it in dmsetup, so i am not sure about this instance.

The libvirt.xml also shows the devices were already file based instead of block based so this seems like a special case.

[~vasya] Any insight into this?
[~jbreiding], I'd assume this is migrated instance on a destination.

[~vasya] Then this is new if that is the case.

Extracting the tar file and deleting the link-to-vd* and renaming the link-to-vd*.orig to remove the .orig should allow it to continue.

But this would need to be solved in the pack script.
[~jcarroll]/[~jbreiding], could you conform that the issue is outcome of previous migration?
What was the block storage device here?

[~tony] None, this was all instance storage.

[~vasya] I will leave that to [~jcarroll]

{quote}
could you conform that the issue is outcome of previous migration?
{quote}

Great question. And I think I know where you're going with this one.

The answer is "maybe".

When I was getting things set up for the upgrade, I figured the option I'd run with would be to first migrate all instances from one NC to the other NC, *then* upgrade the OS of the former NC (install 4.3, restore config, etc).

Thing is, I no longer recall how many instances there were on that NC when I kicked off the migration. If it was one instance, then I'm guessing there might be some overlap with EUCA-12594 ?

The sosreport that I pulled from the frontend prior to upgrading should have the log of how many instances got migrated. I'll see if I can dig that out now.

Found the log snippet. Looks like just the one instance, which matches the problem instance ID noted earlier:

cc.log:

{code}
2016-07-15 16:03:31  INFO 000017060 doMigrateInstances       | [920677a8-838e] migrating instances
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 init_thread              | [920677a8-838e] init=1 0x7f55c4031000 0x7f554575f000 0x7f55c3fab000
2016-07-15 16:03:31  INFO 000017060 doMigrateInstances       | [920677a8-838e] preparing migration from node 10.104.10.24
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 doMigrateInstances       | [920677a8-838e] [i-89995979] scheduling instance with a destination-exclusion list
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_migrat | [920677a8-838e] invoked: include=0, exclude=0
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_migrat | [920677a8-838e] [i-89995979] scheduling migration using ROUNDROBIN scheduler
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_roundr | [920677a8-838e] scheduler using ROUNDROBIN policy to find next resource
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_roundr | [920677a8-838e] scheduler state starting at resource 0
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_roundr | [920677a8-838e] scheduler state finishing at resource 1
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_migrat | [920677a8-838e] [i-89995979] cannot schedule src_index=0 == dst_index=0 (10.104.10.24 > 10.104.10.24), trying again...
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_roundr | [920677a8-838e] scheduler using ROUNDROBIN policy to find next resource
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_roundr | [920677a8-838e] scheduler state starting at resource 1
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_roundr | [920677a8-838e] scheduler state finishing at resource 0
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_migrat | [920677a8-838e] [i-89995979] scheduled: src_index=0, dst_index=1 (10.104.10.24 > 10.104.10.58)
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 schedule_instance_migrat | [920677a8-838e] done
2016-07-15 16:03:31  INFO 000017060 doMigrateInstances       | [920677a8-838e] [i-89995979] scheduled instance migration from 10.104.10.24 to 10.104.10.58
2016-07-15 16:03:31 DEBUG 000017060 doMigrateInstances       | [920677a8-838e] about to ncClientCall source node '10.104.10.24' with nc_instances (prepare 1) [creds='k6kBiDEm8wJfFR2O'] i-89995979
2016-07-15 16:03:33 DEBUG 000017060 refresh_instanceCache    | [920677a8-838e] instance counts: 4/3
2016-07-15 16:03:33 DEBUG 000017060 doMigrateInstances       | [920677a8-838e] calling destination node[s] asynchronously to prepare for 1 incoming migration[s]; using pid 11679
{code}

I've modified nodeadmin-pack-instance on odc-f-16 to deal with this situation correctly.

The instance is now unpacked correctly on odc-c-24.

[~tony], I'd think if a user migrated instances in past s/he can migrated them during upgrade and don't use pack/unpack, so this issue could be wait till 4.3.1. [~dmitrii], do you know any non-migration related cases where system would not use device mapper?

Good question, [~vasya]. And good catch, [~jcarroll]! I think if there is no space in the cache when an instance is created, then instance backing may not involve device mapper files. Or it certainly looks different enough that the following case is worth testing:
* clear out cache and work blobstores
* set cache size to 0 or something small
* restart NC
* run an instance store instance and confirm that cache is avoided
* try packing and unpacking that instance
I am guessing the above will work if 'pack' does not rely on device mapper files alone.
[~jcarroll]/[~jbreiding], could you check zero size cache case?
[~vasya] Yes I will check that scenario. Stay tuned for an update.

0 cache case has an libvirt.xml shown below


{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<domain type="kvm">
  <name>i-515eb94f</name>
  <description>Eucalyptus instance i-515eb94f</description>
  <os>
    <type>hvm</type>
  </os>
  <features>
    <acpi/>
  </features>
  <clock offset="localtime"/>
  <on_poweroff>destroy</on_poweroff>
  <on_reboot>restart</on_reboot>
  <on_crash>destroy</on_crash>
  <vcpu>1</vcpu>
  <cpu>
    <topology sockets="1" cores="1" threads="1"/>
  </cpu>
  <memory>262144</memory>
  <devices>
    <disk device="disk" type="file">
      <driver cache="none"/>
      <source file="/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAHCQBEDLEL77F6ZBZ/i-515eb94f/link-to-vda"/>
      <boot order="1"/>
      <target bus="virtio" dev="vda"/>
      <serial>euca-bdm-machine-dev-vda</serial>
    </disk>
    <disk device="disk" type="block">
      <driver cache="none"/>
      <source dev="/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAHCQBEDLEL77F6ZBZ/i-515eb94f/link-to-vdb"/>
      <boot order="2"/>
      <target bus="virtio" dev="vdb"/>
      <serial>euca-bdm-ephemeral0-dev-vdb</serial>
    </disk>
    <interface type="bridge">
      <source bridge="br0"/>
      <mac address="d0:0d:51:5e:b9:4f"/>
      <target dev="vn_i-515eb94f"/>
      <model type="virtio"/>
      <address type="pci" domain="0x0000" bus="0x00" slot="0x02" function="0x0"/>
    </interface>
    <serial type="file">
      <source path="/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAHCQBEDLEL77F6ZBZ/i-515eb94f/console.log"/>
      <target port="1"/>
    </serial>
  </devices>
</domain>
{noformat}

pull request submitted for review.

The problem here is any link-to-vd* that does not you device mapper gets modified.

This change will prevent that change from happening by checking the existence of the new link target.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/pull/62
Looks good to me.

[~jbreiding], please commit your changes into shared with Swathi branch and work with [~jcarroll] on verification. Please make sure that you use a fresh cloud for testing. [~jcarroll]/[~jbreiding], please test that pack/unpack works for HVM, PV, instances after migration and with all cases above if CACHE size set to 0 on NC.

[~vasya] Sure thing, [~swathi] My branch is in the PR on GH.

[~jcarroll] Can you work off of a branch or is there a way you can just copy in two scripts?

[~ccassler] this is now merged into the branches.

The simplest test is to attempt to pack/unpack an instance that has been migrated. This was the conidition [~jcarroll] had found the issue.

The other scenario here is to pack/unpack an instance on an NC that has its cache size set to 0 prior to the instance being run before packing.

[~jbreiding]: I did a test in my test cloud where I migrated a bunch of instances from one NC to another.  I packed those instances and unpacked them on an upgraded NC.  I didn't run into any unpack issues.

Verified.  This appears to be fixed.
{code}
[root@d-15 ~]# rpm -qi eucalyptus-nc
Name        : eucalyptus-nc
Version     : 4.3.0
Release     : 0.25045.376.20160722git3c3c4d7.el7
Architecture: x86_64
Install Date: Tue 26 Jul 2016 12:21:35 PM PDT
Group       : Applications/System
Size        : 4246333
License     : GPLv3
{code}
